full_text: Back in my own hood, @Costellop is standing in Rathmines & Kimmage. I remember when we first went onto @DubCityCouncil & helped establish a rainbow coalition, which set the direction of the city for the next five years. Hope we can do the same again now. #wantgreenvotegreen #le19 https://t.co/EyEdWomdiH

.@Pidge is our candidate in Dublin 8. I may be biased but I think the Dublin suburbs are one of the best places to live in the world. We need to look after them and make them a safe place for children to grow up and thrive. #DublinCanBeHeaven #WantGreenVoteGreen #GreenWave #le19 https://t.co/Re8WevrwQk

As part of his tour showing how public housing can work well, @CiaranCuffe brought us to Wolfe Tone Close. A high quality, high density, mixed use development, right in the heart of the city centre. #wantgreenvotegreen #greenwave #EP2019 https://t.co/DAeyXn7D63

Fantastic cycling/walking tour by @CiaranCuffe to see some of the best examples of social housing in Dublin. We were able to build high quality homes during the most difficult of times. No reason we can't do the same now. #DublinCanBeHeavan #WantGreenVoteGreen #GreenWave #EP2019 https://t.co/vCmr1ceSxq

We've a green mayor @smytho, in #dunlaoghaire, who is one of the most capable politicians I have had the pleasure to meet. I hope we can get a bigger green team on the new council, to plan with real ambition where the county can go from here. #WantGreenVoteGreen #greenwave #le19 https://t.co/k6v0eZlnk5

.@unapower is our Shankill candidate. We are getting a very good response but success will depend on who votes. In the past only 20% of young voters turned up on the day. If you want a green Ireland, then please make sure you vote on 24th of May. #WantGreenVoteGreen #le19 #EP2019 https://t.co/P7dQ9TCdi5

If you want to vote for the best-performing group on climate, with a score of 85, @GreensEP, you have to vote Green on Friday. The've been “a very coherent & uniform group” with a clear & consistent focus on the single most important issue for the planet. https://t.co/nAhtLbZSgW

Down to Rathfarnham then where @wmpriestley is our candidate. A big question for local politicians is how we improve bus/cycling facilities, without taking out so many trees & front gardens? Can we do so by managing traffic, rather than  widening roads? #WantGreenVoteGreen #le19 https://t.co/acta9SndkD
Cycled up to Stocking lane to canvass for @FNDuffy. Very friendly affair all together. #GreenWave #WantGreenVoteGreen #LE19 https://t.co/dPIa9vrPgV

.@caroline1conroy is running for us in Ballymun & Finglas. We want every community to have their own healthy local environment. Caroline has a record of delivering on that for her own local area. I think she has a real chance of winning a green seat. #wantgreenvotegreen #LE19 https://t.co/I88GCXCIJD

I've seen @CiaranCuffe campaigning on housing, transport & planning issues for over 35 years. He has a vision for a better Dublin and a determination to help deliver it. He would be a brilliant representative for our city in the European Parliament. #wantgreenvotegreen #EP2019 https://t.co/OnbRkwBcIH

We finished off the day by cycling out to Blackrock for a swim. I spent years bemoaning the lack of safe cycling routes in & around and out of the city. Imagine how wonderful it would be if we built a network of #Galway Greenways. #wantgreenvotegreen #GreenWave #LE19 #ibikeivote https://t.co/8mEHIwA9eR

Our three Galway city candidates Claire Hillery @paulinegalway & Martina O'Connor stopped off in @MurphysIceCream for a break. The Council should have a bigger say in how the city grows from here. We want more of the #Galway that people love. #wantgreenvotegreen  #LE19 #GreenWave https://t.co/fYKr3LVeOV

Canvassing Shop Street in Galway this afternoon, getting a very good response, which reflects the latest polls. We've great candidates right across the country, giving it their all. Flat out now for the last week. So we bring that vote home. #wantgreenvotegreen #greenwave #LE19 https://t.co/0xpee88eMI

'Everyone has to make an effort, everyone has to come together.' @SeafraBlackrock is our Blackrock candidate. We need every young person to come out & vote next Friday. The future is in your hands. #wantgreenvotegreen #greenwave #LE19 @greenparty_ie #blackrock https://t.co/aTfgQWllq2

Out canvassing with @EvaDowling tonight there were a number of people asking what powers & responsibilities do our local representatives have. Not enough is the answer. We need Councillors who are willing and able to take tough decisions on our behalf.  #WantGreenVoteGreen #LE19 https://t.co/CT4ai5TqBi
Of course, sometimes it dosen't go to plan. #TakeTwo @greenparty_ie #EP2019 https://t.co/LMMmFMvN6x

I am so proud of European election team. They are giving it their all, travelling at great lenghts to get our message out. Listening to others with respect but speaking with an urgency and integrity, that I think is striking home. If you #WantGreenVoteGreen in #EP2019 #greenwave https://t.co/CSs9plo9r8

We want greens in the European Parliament because that's where the rules to switch to clean energy & pay farmers for protecting nature are made. That's where funding for good urban development can come from & where the new circular economy is being designed. @CiaranCuffe #EP2019 https://t.co/igd8JjiG7U

.@LeoVaradkar says the declaration of a climate/biodiversity crisis is just symbolic. He should instead admit his #ProjectIreland40 plan needs to be abandoned and introduce a new one which sets us on a true course to be a net zero emissions island by 2050. @GraceOSllvn #EP2019 https://t.co/mawiAXPudo

Our message is for the whole country in this election. I think we'll see farming communities voting green in big numbers. They're just as concerned about the future for their children as anyone else. They experience climate change more than anyone else. @saoirse_mchugh #EP2019 https://t.co/Hhjdnob2pM

We can build cost-rental housing that’s high-quality, close to the centre, delivers for a variety of different people – a mix of people in social & public housing, but at the end of it, we own the asset, not some other private operator. #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/U78ynLYgHt

With our Dundalk candidates @CllrMarianne & @eoin_daly_green. The town centre has been hollowed out by bad planning decisions over the years. Our Councillors fought them all the way, often alone.The fight back starts now to bring life back to the centre. #WantGreenVoteGreen #LE19 https://t.co/WbKceuLufr

Head EU climate civil servant "The political contradiction of our day - we've a real fear for our climate future but still a deep seated resistance to the changes we need to make." You can watch him now presenting to our Oireachtas climate committee here: https://t.co/BYllxiFFvQ https://t.co/ETyPPKg9cR

.@LourdaScott is our Greystones candidate. She was encouraged to run by the good work of @women4election. Almost half of our candidates are female. We are slowly but surely changing Irish politics for the better. Diversity brings better decision making. #WantGreenVoteGreen #LE19 https://t.co/xuoJd2uMSY

“It's essential the expansion of Irish agriculture, particularly bovine agriculture, combined with the current model of non-native forestry, mismanagement of peatlands & overfishing are rigorously critiqued in light of the declared biodiversity emergency.” https://t.co/Wbt1xpvjLQ
"We bike, we vote, politicians take note." @dublincycling @Cyclistie @IBIKEDublin #LE19 #EP2019 #ibikeivote https://t.co/C7clSTTJY9

.@neasa_neasa giving a great presentation on how we can create better civic spaces in our cities. Part of a public meeting organised by @CiaranCuffe on Housing and Livible cities.  #wantgreenvotegreen #LE19 #EP2019 #GreenWave https://t.co/AHSGppGz1e

A big issue on the doors is the inability of young people to afford housing. The public has lost faith in @FineGael & their ideological reliance on the private market to deliver social housing. We want the land agency to use public lands for 'cost rental' & social housing. #LE19 https://t.co/KNZZVZ3vg6

.@DeirdreNiF is our #LE19 candidate in Glencullen/Sandyford. She is a barrister with 20 years experience in construction law, with a special interest in trying to improve building standards. We want Greens on every council, to improve local development plans. #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/MnnW5PZ0ZH

Is the State getting value from the broadband deal? The developer only has a small local team. He invests €175 million versus our €3 billion, yet ends up owning the asset. Could the Dept. not manage the roll out itself? Economic competence of @FineGael increasingly questioned. https://t.co/BSdxWQbYZT

Questioning @RichardbrutonTD; it appears the National Broadband Plan mandates the developer to connect to up to an additional 60,000 new houses in rural Ireland. Hard to see how that marries with the National Planning Framework objective to concentrate new housing in urban areas. https://t.co/pJKJq3cBiD
@stephenrdolan @liam_bs @TheKavOfficial @nessmul18 @FNDuffy And of course @wmpriestley @SuzaMcEneaney & @davidmrsn but i will be out with them on another night.

Massive respect to our South Dublin candidates: @liam_bs in Tallaght South @TheKavOfficial in Clondalkin & @nessmul18 in Lucan. We want to turn South Dublin Green. #wantgreenvotegreen #LE19  #thinkglobalactlocal #greenwave https://t.co/YPrJ48GVy6

'Now if you love our planet, come sing along with me. We have to save our planet, there is no planet B.'  Climate strikers outside Dáil Éireann, the day after we declared a climate & biodiversity emergency.  @GretaThunberg #schoolstrike4climate #FridaysForFuture #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/TtgctiucOE

Let's keep up the pressure. It's  time for climate action now. Climate Strikers outside the Dail today. #schoolstrike4climate #FridaysForFurture #ClimateEmergency  #climatestrike #24thMay https://t.co/poIRp6Pbh6

Now we've declared a climate and biodiversity emergency it's time to act.  We must stop issuing oil & gas exploration licenses and the extraction of peat.  We need new transport and land use plans.  We build a circular economy which avoids single use plastics.  #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/sfOUK5YAzV

@Virgofolkie @cathmartingreen @greenparty_ie @europeangreens @CAugustenborg @BirdWatchIE @Irishwildlife @GreenPartyNI @GreenNews_ie @KOSullivanIT @DiarmuidGBurke Hopefully after your next Presidential election. Many thanks.
.@RTENewsPaulC explains what went on in the Dail this evening. I was glad to move the amendment and have the motion agreed.   https://t.co/YCfq0viZot

We formally launched our EU Election campaign today. @ClareBaileyGPNI up North @CiaranCuffe in Dublin @GraceOSllvn Ireland South @saoirse_mchugh Midlands/North/West. A #greenwave is building. Would be great to have Irish Greens back in the Parliament. #WantGreenVoteGreen  #EP2019 https://t.co/1stXdf4jk1

@gold_lgold It was strange. I moved the Fianna Fail amendment and the motion as amended was agreed, without anyone calling a vote in opposition to it. Still glad it was agreed. Time for climate action now.

Glad Dail Eireann (in unusual circumstances) has just declared a climate & biodiversity emergency & has endorsed the report of the Joint Oireachtas Committee on Climate Action https://t.co/M6d66BfNrq We now must act on the report, with a #GreenNewDeal delivering a #JustTransition https://t.co/z31N5R9D1d

What you also find is that most candidates are already deeply involved in their local community; coaching sports, doing clean ups, volunteering on local resident committee et al. Politics is an extention of that instinct. It's something to be encouraged and celebrated. #democracy https://t.co/V0dsJzPSd9

For most candidates it is their friends & family who join them on the campaign trail. @BrianLeddin has a head start, as his mother Kathleen was a former mayor of Limerick city. I think he will make a great new Limerick Leader. #WantGreenVoteGreen #LE19 @greenparty_ie https://t.co/1IzFaAj8KM
